literal_meaning: To fall from a pear tree.
example: When he announced his resignation, I felt like I had fallen from a pear tree.

literal_meaning: To have a cat in a bag.
figurative_meaning: To take a risk without knowing what you will get.
example: Buying that car was like having a cat in a bag; I didn't know if it would work well.
The project is going kao po loju; everything is on track.

literal_meaning: Not all that glitters is gold.
example: That deal seemed great, but remember: nije sve zlato što sija.

figurative_meaning: To be in a strong position.
example: After securing that contract, he is really biti na konju now.
It didn’t even fall on my mind to ask for help; pasti na pamet.

literal_meaning: To be like a fish in water.
figurative_meaning: To feel comfortable or at ease.
example: He is like a fish in water when he’s playing music.

idiom: Imaš sreće kao da si pao s kruške
literal_meaning: You have luck as if you fell from a pear tree.
example: Winning that prize means you have sreće kao da si pao s kruške.

literal_meaning: To hold your tongue behind your teeth.
figurative_meaning: To keep quiet or not speak.
example: He decided to držati jezik za zubima during the meeting.

literal_meaning: To be in the seventh sky.
example: She was in sedmom nebu after receiving the good news.
